commit_message:
CI: set the tempest plugin's partition_netboot option

We need it to work around the inability of CirrOS partition images
to do legacy local boot. This option already exists but is never set.

Also set the new default_boot_option parameter.

Change-Id: I75605cda40f039ef65c7c39058cbcaa449509013

commit_message:
Tag governance 0.12.0 for Feb-Mar 2022 elections

OpenStack Election system requires tagging on governance repos,
tagging 0.12.0 for Feb-Mar 2022 elections.

hash as per the Feb-Mar election email deadline is taken:
2022-02-15

Change-Id: I556d2394acb7fdfeaa4a2143d4d31d93f929dd48

which is "/etc/puppet/modules" [3][4].

When we don't install puppet modules from source

(as we do in [1][2]) in PUPPETFILE_DIR directory
which is "/etc/puppet/modules". This dir is in the path

This patch doesn't change current behavior, as we always
set $MANAGE_PUPPET_MODULES as true [4], and we don't

Note that currently, when we enable puppet modules RPM, we install
puppet modules with both RPM and from sources. Puppet modules from
RPM goes in "/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules", and modules from
source goes in /etc/puppet/modules [6]. But as the RPM module dir is

commit_message:
Copy current p-o-i project in PUPPETFILE_DIR

When we don't install puppet modules from source
we still need to copy the current p-o-i project
(as we do in [1][2]) in PUPPETFILE_DIR directory
which is "/etc/puppet/modules". This dir is in the path
for both RPM installation and source installation [3].

This patch doesn't change current behavior, as we always
set $MANAGE_PUPPET_MODULES as true [4], and we don't
override it in [5].

Note that currently, when we enable puppet modules RPM, we install
puppet modules with both RPM and from sources. Puppet modules from
RPM goes in "/usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules", and modules from
source goes in /etc/puppet/modules [6]. But as the RPM module dir is
first in modulepath [3] ("earlier directories having priority over
later ones" [7]) we use RPM ones.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/c8175c5b329d6cea0fb127bde2efe0a52805609a/functions#L92
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/c8175c5b329d6cea0fb127bde2efe0a52805609a/functions#L77
[3] https://github.com/rdo-infra/ansible-role-weirdo-puppet-openstack/blob/4d676307eb52fc33ea8562f57c4d6028ffe1cd02/defaults/main.yml#L54
[4] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/c8175c5b329d6cea0fb127bde2efe0a52805609a/run_tests.sh#L23
[5] https://github.com/rdo-infra/ansible-role-weirdo-puppet-openstack/blob/master/tasks/main.yml#L114#L123
[6] https://github.com/rdo-infra/ansible-role-weirdo-puppet-openstack/blob/4d676307eb52fc33ea8562f57c4d6028ffe1cd02/tasks/main.yml#L121
[7] https://puppet.com/docs/puppet/5.5/dirs_modulepath.html

Change-Id: I9366744d473c535eefa087194bb8e296e736cb36

commit_message:
Restrict centos 8 content provider to train/u/v/wallaby only

In the parent patch at [1] we are doing the same for all other
centos8 jobs. This finally also removes the c8 content provider
from master runs by restricting to t/u/v/w on branches: See [2]
for other related reviews.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/826317
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:c8_teardown_master

Change-Id: If2a920a5ee944765ba93cf782e584ef4e5bd32e6

[{'created': '2021-09-10 14:31:51.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icbc1c15afa0d98cb40f7bf20c7ff07c783f1597e
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Icbc1c15afa0d98cb40f7bf20c7ff07c783f1597e

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I880c4ee202c2f70960cadc13b7e688dff03fdf30

commit_message:
libvirt: Add property to set number of screens per video adapter

This patch adds the following property:

  - hw_video_screens  (sets libvirt's 'heads' XML attribute)

This property can be used to specify the number of screens of a
video adapter.

Change-Id: I8bfc199625ed910e95d2b3e70f56423dd285fe55

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-04 11:15:07.000000000', 'message': "Ceph: Use centos-8-stream instead of centos-8

Conflicts:
	configure_facts.sh
	manifests/repos.pp

Backport note:
This backport includes part of f384effdb42e0cbe19e137f0411b09ac8fef5b48
which fixed the repository url used when mirror info is not available.

Also, this adds a puppet-openstack_extras parameter to enforce usage of
stream repo. Default was changed during Xena cycle by [1] but that
is not present in stable/wallaby and older.
  [1] cf8b734766bbe75ac5ce23d7a4237b77c8200dd3

Finally, Nautilus is not available in ceph mirror so we'll switch to
the mirror repo currently RDO is hosting.

Change-Id: I97995b6821a24b64edbc5b1e874ba67a0418f96a
(cherry picked from commit b2fa6c0e7bb6d5e319cd820484c120d043f58ab2)
(cherry picked from commit 8c00b663d38a0f71cc2d108ff799f7aaa0b8f9e0)
(cherry picked from commit 4d6a35effa25b23e1f345402ca5ef34df74b7674)
(cherry picked from commit 0a9eec11e0db740bac5ee4e4a303e710c41137a7)
(cherry picked from commit 683bb18852b9656b613f4b37a2e8aa80e60df337)
"}, {'created': '2022-02-08 15:32:40.000000000', 'message': "Ceph: Use centos-8-stream instead of centos-8

Conflicts:
	configure_facts.sh
	manifests/repos.pp

Backport note:
This backport includes part of f384effdb42e0cbe19e137f0411b09ac8fef5b48
which fixed the repository url used when mirror info is not available.

Also, this adds a puppet-openstack_extras parameter to enforce usage of
stream repo. Default was changed during Xena cycle by [1] but that
is not present in stable/wallaby and older.
  [1] cf8b734766bbe75ac5ce23d7a4237b77c8200dd3

In addition, this bumps Ceph used in Puppet 5 integration job in
CentOS 8 from luminous to nautilus, because luminous is quite old and
no longer hosted in mirror.

Finally, Nautilus is not available in ceph mirror so we'll switch to
the mirror repo currently RDO is hosting.

During backporting the change to stable/train, additional logic was
added to use non-stream repo for CentOS7.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828359

commit_message:
Ceph: Use centos-8-stream instead of centos-8

Conflicts:
	configure_facts.sh
	manifests/repos.pp

Backport note:
This backport includes part of f384effdb42e0cbe19e137f0411b09ac8fef5b48
which fixed the repository url used when mirror info is not available.

Also, this adds a puppet-openstack_extras parameter to enforce usage of
stream repo. Default was changed during Xena cycle by [1] but that
is not present in stable/wallaby and older.
  [1] cf8b734766bbe75ac5ce23d7a4237b77c8200dd3

In addition, this bumps Ceph used in Puppet 5 integration job in
CentOS 8 from luminous to nautilus, because luminous is quite old and
no longer hosted in mirror.

Finally, Nautilus is not available in ceph mirror so we'll switch to
the mirror repo currently RDO is hosting.

During backporting the change to stable/train, additional logic was
added to use non-stream repo for CentOS7.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828359

Change-Id: I97995b6821a24b64edbc5b1e874ba67a0418f96a
(cherry picked from commit b2fa6c0e7bb6d5e319cd820484c120d043f58ab2)
(cherry picked from commit 8c00b663d38a0f71cc2d108ff799f7aaa0b8f9e0)
(cherry picked from commit 4d6a35effa25b23e1f345402ca5ef34df74b7674)
(cherry picked from commit 0a9eec11e0db740bac5ee4e4a303e710c41137a7)
(cherry picked from commit 73fc9c7cffe81d9a9afe1c12cb67d09e5b3d78ba)

commit_message:
Avoid using git -C

The git version that ships with centos 7 does not support the -C flag.
This patch works around it's usage in the dlrn-build.yml playbook

Closes-Bug: #1960973
Change-Id: Iae6cdfa82fe68ff0de1da789378845950d70f03e

Will need couple of tests

Change-Id: I1495128dc3087bc728a51cf667a8fb394fe87893
'}, {'created': '2022-01-26 10:39:10.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Allow dlrn builds from both deploy release and upgrade release

Will need couple of tests

Implement the following logic to trigger DLRN builds or skip it:

D=((A==B) or (A==C) and (B==C or A==C)) and
  (A>C or (A=~'stable/a' and C=~'stable/z'))
Which means treat the future stable/a as a more recent release than
stable/z.

Assuming an example V->W upgrade job against stable/wallaby branch:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
A		B		C		D
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
item.branch	(osp_)release	override_br	to build?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
V		V		V		Yes
                                        (for V, build V (not W) deps *)
V		V		W		Yes
V		W		V		No
V		W		W		No
W		V		V		No
W		V		W		Yes
W		W		V		Yes
                                             (for W, build W+V deps **)
W		W		W		Yes
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
* Do pre-deploy DLRN build for V deps. Skip W deps as newer packages
  would break deployment. It is epxected that release would be Victoria
  at this stage of the upgrade job execution.

** Do pre-upgrade DLRN build for W deps. Also build for V deps, since
  the older verions will be ignored during upgrade. Release should switch
  to Wallaby at this stage (by emit releases mechanics in tripleo CI).

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1495128dc3087bc728a51cf667a8fb394fe87893

"}, {'created': '2022-01-27 12:57:33.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Allow dlrn builds from both deploy release and upgrade release

Will need couple of tests

Implement the following logic to trigger DLRN builds or skip it:

D=((A==B) or (A==C) and (B==C or A==C)) and
  (A>C or C=~'stable/z'))
Which means treat the future stable/a as a more recent release than
stable/z (also the master branch would be).

Between consequent DLRN builds ensure there is no "dirty" state, to
avoid "Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found" errors.

Assuming an example V->W upgrade job against stable/wallaby branch:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
A		B		C		D
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
item.branch	(osp_)release	override_br	to build?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
V		V		V		Yes
                                        (for V, build V deps *)
V		V		W		Yes
V		W		V		No
                                             (for W, skip V deps **)
V		W		W		No
W		V		V		No
                                        (for V, skip W deps)
W		V		W		Yes
W		W		V		Yes
                                             (for W, build W deps)
W		W		W		Yes
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
* Do pre-deploy DLRN build for V deps. Skip W deps as newer packages
  would break deployment. It is epxected that release would be Victoria
  at this stage of the upgrade job execution.

** Do pre-upgrade DLRN build for W deps. Skip V deps. Release should
  be switched to Wallaby at this stage. Between cosequent DLRN builds
  purge its DB to avoid "Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found"
  error.

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1495128dc3087bc728a51cf667a8fb394fe87893
'}, {'created': '2022-01-28 09:54:56.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Allow dlrn builds from both deploy release and upgrade release

Will need couple of tests

Implement the following logic to trigger DLRN builds or skip it:

D=((A==B) or (A==C) and (B==C or A==C)) and
  (A>=C or C=~'stable/z'))
Which means treat the future stable/a as a more recent release than
stable/z (also the master branch would be).

Between consequent DLRN builds ensure there is no "dirty" state, to
avoid "Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found" errors.

Assuming an example V->W upgrade job against stable/wallaby branch:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
A		B		C		D
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
item.branch	(osp_)release	override_br	to build?
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
V		V		V		Yes
                                        (for V, build V deps *)
V		V		W		Yes
V		W		V		No
                                             (for W, skip V deps **)
V		W		W		No
W		V		V		No
                                        (for V, skip W deps)
W		V		W		Yes
W		W		V		Yes
                                             (for W, build W deps)
W		W		W		Yes
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
* Do pre-deploy DLRN build for V deps. Skip W deps as newer packages
  would break deployment. It is epxected that release would be Victoria
  at this stage of the upgrade job execution.

** Do pre-upgrade DLRN build for W deps. Skip V deps. Release should
  be switched to Wallaby at this stage. Between cosequent DLRN builds
  purge its DB to avoid "Installed (but unpackaged) file(s) found"
  error.

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1495128dc3087bc728a51cf667a8fb394fe87893

commit_message:
Allow dlrn builds from both deploy release and upgrade release

DLRN with --local and --dev options uses whatever already checked
out source and distgit[1]. So in order to get packages build for
multiple releases like in upgrade jobs we need to prepare both
source(git clean and git checkout) and distgit(remove it so
DLRN fetches it based on config).

Also use release var to compute what change to build when it's
defined, when not defined use zuul override-checkout or branch.
Additionally add non-cached fact artg_change_list_prep to compute
the changes list as using artg_change_list causes inclusion of
changes from previous run.

[1] https://github.com/softwarefactory-project/DLRN/issues/39

Co-authored-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1958995
Change-Id: I1495128dc3087bc728a51cf667a8fb394fe87893

commit_message:
Add SSL verification for DLRN actions

In downstream build-test-packages is failing on Task
: Run DLRN because with [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED]

Exporting correct cert before running DLRN actions.

Change-Id: I312d5da0a06d0b7c9dbc1e43bb1e8022dc8b5e1c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-29 18:19:05.000000000', 'message': 'Improve resource listing efficiency

Cinder's resource tables (volumes, snapshots, backups, groups) don't
have required indexes to do efficient resource listings on the database
engine.

This forces the database to go through all existing database records for
any listing (even when there are no additional user requested filtering)
and check one by one the conditions.

As an example a simple listing for a project with a single volume:

$ cinder list
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
| ID                                   | Status    | Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
| 8a6b11d5-3343-4c0d-8a64-8e7070d1988e | available | test | 1    | lvmdriver-1 | false    |             |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+

May result in the database going through thousand of records (all
deleted records and all records for other projects) as demonstrated by
the following SQL queries where 10435 rows were checks to return a
single on:

$ mysql cinder -e 'select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+--------------------------------------+--------------+
| id                                   | display_name |
+--------------------------------------+--------------+
| 8a6b11d5-3343-4c0d-8a64-8e7070d1988e | test         |
+--------------------------------------+--------------+

$ mysql cinder -e 'explain select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+------+-------------+---------+------+---------------+------+---------+------+-------+-------------+
| id   | select_type | table   | type | possible_keys | key  | key_len | ref  | rows  | Extra       |
+------+-------------+---------+------+---------------+------+---------+------+-------+-------------+
|    1 | SIMPLE      | volumes | ALL  | NULL          | NULL | NULL    | NULL | 10435 | Using where |
+------+-------------+---------+------+---------------+------+---------+------+-------+-------------+

This patch introduces a project_id and deleted index for volumes,
snapshots, groups, and backups tables, which will allow the database to
do efficient retrieval of records for listings.

We can see the new index this patch adds and how it allows the DB engine
to efficiently retrieve non deleted volumes from the specific project.

$ mysql cinder -e 'show index from volumes'
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+
| Table   | Non_unique | Key_name                       | Seq_in_index | Column_name         | Collation | Cardinality | Sub_part | Packed | Null | Index_type | Comment | Index_comment |
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+
| volumes |          0 | PRIMARY                        |            1 | id                  | A         |       10435 |     NULL | NULL   |      | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_service_uuid_idx       |            1 | service_uuid        | A         |           4 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_service_uuid_idx       |            2 | deleted             | A         |           6 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | ix_volumes_group_id            |            1 | group_id            | A         |           2 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | ix_volumes_consistencygroup_id |            1 | consistencygroup_id | A         |           2 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx |            1 | project_id          | A         |           4 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx |            2 | deleted             | A         |           6 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+

$ mysql cinder -e 'explain select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
| id   | select_type | table   | type | possible_keys                  | key                            | key_len | ref         | rows | Extra                 |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
|    1 | SIMPLE      | volumes | ref  | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | 770     | const,const |    1 | Using index condition |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+

Closes-Bug: #1952443
Change-Id: I8456a9f82bdf18ada76874dc0c4f59542e1c03ab

+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+

$ mysql cinder -e 'explain select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
| id   | select_type | table   | type | possible_keys                  | key                            | key_len | ref         | rows | Extra                 |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
|    1 | SIMPLE      | volumes | ref  | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | 770     | const,const |    1 | Using index condition |

The patch also updates 3 tests that were expecting the result from a

| volumes |          1 | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx |            2 | deleted             | A         |           6 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+

$ mysql cinder -e 'explain select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
| id   | select_type | table   | type | possible_keys                  | key                            | key_len | ref         | rows | Extra                 |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
|    1 | SIMPLE      | volumes | ref  | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | 770     | const,const |    1 | Using index condition |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+

The patch also updates 3 tests that were expecting the result from a
query to be in a specific order when there is no actual ORDER BY in the
query.

Closes-Bug: #1952443
Change-Id: I8456a9f82bdf18ada76874dc0c4f59542e1c03ab
'}]
commit_message:
Improve resource listing efficiency

Cinder's resource tables (volumes, snapshots, backups, groups) don't
have required indexes to do efficient resource listings on the database
engine.

This forces the database to go through all existing database records for
any listing (even when there are no additional user requested filtering)
and check one by one the conditions.

As an example a simple listing for a project with a single volume:

$ cinder list
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
| ID                                   | Status    | Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+
| 8a6b11d5-3343-4c0d-8a64-8e7070d1988e | available | test | 1    | lvmdriver-1 | false    |             |
+--------------------------------------+-----------+------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+

May result in the database going through thousand of records (all
deleted records and all records for other projects) as demonstrated by
the following SQL queries where 10435 rows were checks to return a
single on:

$ mysql cinder -e 'select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+--------------------------------------+--------------+
| id                                   | display_name |
+--------------------------------------+--------------+
| 8a6b11d5-3343-4c0d-8a64-8e7070d1988e | test         |
+--------------------------------------+--------------+

$ mysql cinder -e 'explain select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+------+-------------+---------+------+---------------+------+---------+------+-------+-------------+
| id   | select_type | table   | type | possible_keys | key  | key_len | ref  | rows  | Extra       |
+------+-------------+---------+------+---------------+------+---------+------+-------+-------------+
|    1 | SIMPLE      | volumes | ALL  | NULL          | NULL | NULL    | NULL | 10435 | Using where |
+------+-------------+---------+------+---------------+------+---------+------+-------+-------------+

This patch introduces a project_id and deleted index for volumes,
snapshots, groups, and backups tables, which will allow the database to
do efficient retrieval of records for listings.

We can see the new index this patch adds and how it allows the DB engine
to efficiently retrieve non deleted volumes from the specific project.

$ mysql cinder -e 'show index from volumes'
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+
| Table   | Non_unique | Key_name                       | Seq_in_index | Column_name         | Collation | Cardinality | Sub_part | Packed | Null | Index_type | Comment | Index_comment |
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+
| volumes |          0 | PRIMARY                        |            1 | id                  | A         |       10435 |     NULL | NULL   |      | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_service_uuid_idx       |            1 | service_uuid        | A         |           4 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_service_uuid_idx       |            2 | deleted             | A         |           6 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | ix_volumes_group_id            |            1 | group_id            | A         |           2 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | ix_volumes_consistencygroup_id |            1 | consistencygroup_id | A         |           2 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx |            1 | project_id          | A         |           4 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
| volumes |          1 | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx |            2 | deleted             | A         |           6 |     NULL | NULL   | YES  | BTREE      |         |               |
+---------+------------+--------------------------------+--------------+---------------------+-----------+-------------+----------+--------+------+------------+---------+---------------+

$ mysql cinder -e 'explain select id, display_name from volumes where not deleted and project_id="a41464e54125407aab09e0236cce2c3c"'
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
| id   | select_type | table   | type | possible_keys                  | key                            | key_len | ref         | rows | Extra                 |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+
|    1 | SIMPLE      | volumes | ref  | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | volumes_project_id_deleted_idx | 770     | const,const |    1 | Using index condition |
+------+-------------+---------+------+--------------------------------+--------------------------------+---------+-------------+------+-----------------------+

The patch also updates 3 tests that were expecting the result from a
query to be in a specific order when there is no actual ORDER BY in the
query.

Closes-Bug: #1952443
Change-Id: I8456a9f82bdf18ada76874dc0c4f59542e1c03ab

subject: DNM - patch paramiko to get around ed25519 problem
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2022-02-14 21:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2022-02-14 21:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Set Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2022-02-14 23:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/829135/1/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 31m 57s'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2022-02-16 06:10:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Determined this is an issue with python-cryptography not detecting fips mode because of Openssl 3.x.  Working with a new python-cryptography instead.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-14 21:23:24.000000000', 'message': 'DNM - patch paramiko to get around ed25519 problem

when paramiko is imported, it checks to see if ed25519 curves are
available by trying to generate one.  On a FIPS system, this fails
but not by throwing the exception that paramiko expects.

We patch to get around this to continue the testing, but this patch
will need some work before its ready to commit.  For one thing, we
may chose to fix the underlying cryptography ssl backend to pass back
the right exception instead.

Change-Id: Icd5e2e90c2f2843e088cc69465c64b3ce9dd63fa
'}]
commit_message:
DNM - patch paramiko to get around ed25519 problem

when paramiko is imported, it checks to see if ed25519 curves are
available by trying to generate one.  On a FIPS system, this fails
but not by throwing the exception that paramiko expects.

We patch to get around this to continue the testing, but this patch
will need some work before its ready to commit.  For one thing, we
may chose to fix the underlying cryptography ssl backend to pass back
the right exception instead.

Change-Id: Icd5e2e90c2f2843e088cc69465c64b3ce9dd63fa

commit_message:
[WIP] add healthcheck utils and constants

This change factors out the HealthcheckStatus enum
and cache contol constants into a seperate module

This change introduces a healthcheck utils module
which provide a healthcheck context manager and
healtcheck decorator which automaticaly record
the healthcheck status item based on if the wrapped
code exits normally or raises an expected error.

Change-Id: Id58a0978a34d7a208fd1caa4ff2b718fd926ca19

subject: [WIP] add healthcheck tracker to nova context
messages:
[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2022-02-16 02:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2022-02-16 05:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/829468/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 32m 56s'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-16 02:51:01.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] add healthcheck tracker to nova context

This change adds the healthcheck tracker to the nova
context object by extedning the context module with a
module global _HEALTH_TRACKER and register_healthcheck_tracker
function. The RequestContext __init__ method is extended
with a health_tracker kwarg and the get_context and get_admin_context
functions are modifyied to pass _HEALTH_TRACKER.

These change allow the health tracker to be accessed from
any function that is passed the context object enabling fine grained
health checks to be added in future patches.

Change-Id: I2675794fbb37735189bf4c966508bb3771d1c2f5
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] add healthcheck tracker to nova context

This change adds the healthcheck tracker to the nova
context object by extedning the context module with a
module global _HEALTH_TRACKER and register_healthcheck_tracker
function. The RequestContext __init__ method is extended
with a health_tracker kwarg and the get_context and get_admin_context
functions are modifyied to pass _HEALTH_TRACKER.

These change allow the health tracker to be accessed from
any function that is passed the context object enabling fine grained
health checks to be added in future patches.

Change-Id: I2675794fbb37735189bf4c966508bb3771d1c2f5

commit_message:
TripleO jobs: Replace CentOS 8 jobs by CentOS 9 jobs

Now TripleO team is replacing CentOS 8 jobs in master by CentOS 9 jobs.
This follows that and replaces tripleo jobs in puppet repos to switch
to CentOS 9.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/828525
Change-Id: I8331579cb596658f80728b50989c6a772b914b6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-26 00:04:11.000000000', 'message': "Proxy: override user_agent with backend_user_agent

The proxy currently _ALWAYS_ overrides any user_agent in requests with
`proxy-server <pid>`. This is what we want for any normal request. But
when using the internal client, which itself uses it's own proxy server,
we'd rather use the internal client's defined user_agent, so we can
track the source of the request in logs.

This patch adds a backend_user_agent to the proxy, that when set a proxy
will use this as a user_agent in a request. Additionally a
set_backend_user_agent is created that is then used by the internal
client via a `pipeline_property`, so it call call it down the WSGI
pipeline.

As to not make any change to the InternalClient API, the self.user_agent
has been turned into a property so it behaves as normal, but it can call
self.set_backend_user_agent behind the scenes to set everything up.

Change-Id: I5f7bf65b4e747b5a93b79328fac640b791ecdc95
"}, {'created': '2021-11-26 00:10:21.000000000', 'message': "Proxy: override user_agent with backend_user_agent

track the source of the request in logs.

will use this as a user_agent in a request. Additionally a
set_backend_user_agent is created that is then used by the internal
client via a `pipeline_property`, so it call call it down the WSGI
pipeline.

As to not make any change to the InternalClient API, the self.user_agent
has been turned into a property so it behaves as normal, but it can call
self.set_backend_user_agent behind the scenes to set everything up.

Closes-Bug: #1951304
Change-Id: I5f7bf65b4e747b5a93b79328fac640b791ecdc95
"}, {'created': '2021-12-02 04:27:56.000000000', 'message': "Proxy: override user_agent with backend_user_agent

As to not make any change to the InternalClient API, the self.user_agent

Closes-Bug: #1951304
Change-Id: I5f7bf65b4e747b5a93b79328fac640b791ecdc95
"}, {'created': '2022-01-10 23:15:53.000000000', 'message': "Proxy: override user_agent with backend_user_agent

`proxy-server <pid>`. This is what we want for any normal request. But
when using the internal client, which itself uses it's own proxy server,
we'd rather use the internal client's defined user_agent, so we can
track the source of the request in logs.

This patch adds a backend_user_agent to the proxy, that when set a proxy
will use this as a user_agent in a request.

Every member of the pipeline has a `_pipeline_final_app` to point to the

commit_message:
Proxy: override user_agent with backend_user_agent

The proxy currently _ALWAYS_ overrides any user_agent in requests with
`proxy-server <pid>`. This is what we want for any normal request. But
when using the internal client, which itself uses it's own proxy server,
we'd rather use the internal client's defined user_agent, so we can
track the source of the request in logs.

This patch adds a backend_user_agent to the proxy, that when set a proxy
will use this as a user_agent in a request.

Every member of the pipeline has a `_pipeline_final_app` to point to the
app (proxy), so uses this to directly set the proxies
backend_user_agent.

Closes-Bug: #1951304
Change-Id: I5f7bf65b4e747b5a93b79328fac640b791ecdc95

unit tests has been resolved.

Snmp::Snmpv3_user[ro_snmp_user]: parameter 'authpass' expects

commit_message:
Revert "Pin puppet-snmp"

This reverts commit 040857a738492514bc7b65f18ad89922a1ccb16e.

Reason for revert:
Now rspec-puppet-facts support structured facts and the issue with
unit tests has been resolved.

This change fixes the following error in unit tests, caused by
parameter validation in puppet-snmpd.

Snmp::Snmpv3_user[ro_snmp_user]: parameter 'authpass' expects
a String[8] value, got String

Change-Id: Ib8650d553ae7cef0197a26acac0aa17a04433f28

I'm fine to be a bit more unspecific here ;-). (One point: I do not really agree, that the -nv are as stable as the voting - my impression is, that very often at least one of the jobs is red.)

Nevertheless it is hard for a user to decide if his/her installed version of diskimage-builder officially supports the target he/she is about to build. (Example: the Debian package even does not ship the run_functests.sh script [1]).

And what do you think is currently 'stable' for fedora or ubuntu?

As a first entry point this patch may work, but IMHO at some place we should document in detail which build host and targets are official supported for the shipped version of diskimage-builder.

I filed this bug, because during the development of the docker matrix build [2] there was no way of building Centos6. For this patch I need a (machine readable) file that describes the supported distributions. The preliminary result: [3]. My idea here is to long-term add something like 'non-voting', 'deprecated', or 'on-horizon' to the value list of 'true' and 'false' for 'host:' and 'target:'.
(This file started really small - but because there is currently the need to include a couple of patches to get at least a minimal set of images build - its somewhat lengthy. But this will shrink is the problems get fixed.)

So I'm not really sure here. Any argument or a way forward?

[1] https://packages.debian.org/jessie/all/python-diskimage-builder/filelist
[2] https://review.openstack.org/414347
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414347/22/tests/supported_distros.yaml"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-01-10 19:17:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-10 20:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

After lots of thinking and looking around I came to the conclusion that we cannot stop supporting all these distributions because mainly there are no test cases for them.

For Nova release there are mainly four distributions [1] where OpenStack can be installed. It would be hard to understand telling somebody: you can install OpenStack on openSUSE or Debian but you cannot build any disk images there.

My idea: pick up the list from [1] (have maybe a discussion about a somewhat longer target list: add gentoo and Fedora?) and try to get the best test coverage as possible with our (limited) resources.

(According to [2] we can drop Ubuntu-Trusty support.)

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/newton/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/110495.html'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-01-20 05:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@Andreas - across a few of your changes I think I'm starting to get a feeling for where you're heading

In this particular review, I've tried quite carefully to not say things are "supported" or not -- just tried to explain (and show) in clear terms what is proven to work via testing at any given point.

I realise you understand this, but there is no "supported".  That implies some sort of future contract, but when it comes down to it, nobody can or will force any contributor to care about any particular problem that might occur tomorrow.  This is why I'd prefer we talk about what is "stable".  That has a concrete definition -- we can unequivocally say "at changeset xyz these elements were shown to be stable as they passed abc tests".

The voting gate elements are our highest stable bar -- as a project our forward-progress is dependent on them so whilst the project is alive any problem in those elements or platforms is certain to get immediate attention.  I would group api compatibility breaks in there, though ideally we've got coverage preventing that as part of voting unit-tests anyway.  The non-voting tests are slightly lower but we keep them going and can at least show what state they're in.

Of course this leaves lots of elements and paths that are untested.  some of these are, in practice, 3rd-party tested by things like the daily infra build, tripleo, or nodepool/devstack jobs, etc; These are in effect stable, although on a slightly different time line to the gate jobs (i'm thinking stuff like simple-init).

That is just the reality of the situation.  I still feel like this change reflects this accurately in the documentation

---

I'm not opposed to adding elements that may not be fully gate tested, especially if they're mostly using our standard apis that we keep stable.  This is just being practical, often working with whatever history we have.  I'd just like it to be clear to contributors what they're getting ... if they feel strongly their element needs to be gating then we need to have conversations about how we work that in.

---

It seems you're quite interested in having hosts we currently have no testing for like suse, fedora, debian and gentoo able to build images.  I am not really opposed to putting in reasonable changes so those platforms can build.  If it doesn't break the gate, and mostly fits with what we have, OK.

Testing these, and hence being able to make any sort of claim they are "stable", raises strong questions for me.  You've proposed adding to dib a moderately complicated docker/container-based deployment system to roll out generic container images for these platforms and then deploy dib in them.  To have them show they are "stable" -- at the same level as gate platforms ubuntu & centos -- we then have to duplicate our gate testing inside them.

The ubuntu & centos platforms we run gate tests embed literally thousands of person-hours of knowledge on what makes CI work inside things like project-config build elements, infra puppet and job-runners (zuul).  It means the testing environment is doing stuff like caching (git trees, images, pip mirror pointers), jobs use standard elements like zuul-cloner (dependencies) and bindep, jobs are configured and debuggable using all our standard methods, nodes are scheduled and managed by nodepool, individual jobs are controlled by zuul-launcher, and, most important to me, there's a huge corpus of smart developers who understand what's going on and support the framework.

I don't want dib to go down the path of almost shipping a mini-kubernetes that is completely isolated within a single test and either does bespoke platform deployment that isn't like the other jobs, or takes the other approach and starts duplicating bits of infra inside it.  When it inevitably goes wrong it is totally outside all our existing support mechanisms and requires way too much bootstrapping to even figure out what's wrong.

I'm sure docker/containers for testing has a role in openstack-infra.  In theory, at least, infra could generate gentoo/debian/fedora/suse/anything containers (using dib!) that are siblings to the qcow's we build.  I would not have any problem with dib consuming these to run tests on.  I know you're interested in local testing -- there's no reason you can't locally rebuild the containers (of course we can make that easy), or we can do things like make the containers available for download so you can replicate the gate exactly locally.

But I really hope any work done on these platforms can be leveraged to help the whole project.

---

Sorry for dumping this here.  I do hope this clarifies some of my recent comments with a larger overview of what I think the dib ecosystem is.  I reserve the right to change my mind on anything :)'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-01-21 07:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> In this particular review, I've tried quite carefully to not say
> things are "supported" or not -- just tried to explain (and show) in
> clear terms what is proven to work via testing at any given point.

I think I got your point about 'stable' vs. 'supported' now - and I
support it ;-). What makes your patch a bit ambiguous is, that the
headline of the commit, the headline of the document and the name of
the file with all your changes in includes 'support[ed]'.

Maybe it's also worth to explicitly state that 'stable' does not mean
'supported'?

> That is just the reality of the situation.  I still feel like this
> change reflects this accurately in the documentation

Good documentation!

Because of the current discussion about aarch64 it maybe makes sense
to explicitly state, that all the testing is (currently) done only for
amd64?

I'm +2 with this patch after adapting these nits.

---

IMHO the rest of your comment is more about testing and fits better to
the 'Docker Matrix Build' proposal - therefore I'll comment your
arguments there.

---

> Sorry for dumping this here.  I do hope this clarifies some of my
> recent comments with a larger overview of what I think the dib
> ecosystem is.  I reserve the right to change my mind on anything :)

I want to thank you for your patience and great explanations! (Your
last sentence is also valid for me!)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-01-23 01:04:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-01-23 01:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified+1

'}, {'created': '2017-01-23 01:04:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update platform support to describe stable testing

The reality is that "stable" is what is tested, despite anything that
might be written down.  Instead of saying we support a bunch of
platforms we don't currently test, this tries to give enough info that
developers can ascertain what tests are running at any given time and
hence what elements are known to be working.

To aid anyone wondering what a given release was testing,
auto-generate a formatted list of the functional-testing elements.
For the documentation of any given release, this is essentially a
watermark of what it was tested with.

This adds a check to dib-lint to ensure this list is in sync.  If the
list changes, the user is prompted to re-generate it (i.e. it should
not be able to be out of sync, the gate jobs won't pass).

Additional, clarify the Fedora position in the README as now described
by above.

Closes: #1653561

commit_message:
Update platform support to describe stable testing

The reality is that "stable" is what is tested.  This tries to give
enough info that users can ascertain what tests are running at any
given time and hence what elements are known to be working.

Additional, clarify the Fedora position in the README as now described
by above.

Closes: #1653561
Change-Id: Ifb91b9089790897861bd7e671c3dba59adac239d

[{'created': '2022-02-15 13:23:56.000000000', 'message': 'Change parenting on C9 jobs to not inherit directly from c8 versions

As seen with the merge of [1] some of the c9 jobs stopped running
because the branches: match between c9 and parent c8 were compliments
i.e. "^(?!stable/(train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby)).*$" vs
"^(stable/(train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby)).*$". To avoid that we
remove the direct parenting e.g. centos-9-undercloud-containers
no longer inherits from centos-8-undercloud-containers and
instead carries the required vars.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/826317

Change-Id: I99ab7f88e0e6edc25be98edf985294a3a8ef3faf
'}]
commit_message:
Change parenting on C9 jobs to not inherit directly from c8 versions

As seen with the merge of [1] some of the c9 jobs stopped running
because the branches: match between c9 and parent c8 were compliments
i.e. "^(?!stable/(train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby)).*$" vs
"^(stable/(train|ussuri|victoria|wallaby)).*$". To avoid that we
remove the direct parenting e.g. centos-9-undercloud-containers
no longer inherits from centos-8-undercloud-containers and
instead carries the required vars.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/826317

Change-Id: I99ab7f88e0e6edc25be98edf985294a3a8ef3faf

[{'created': '2022-02-11 14:35:10.000000000', 'message': "Add option to bootstrap cephadm without --image

By default 'openstack overcloud ceph deploy' calls
'cephadm bootstrap --image' where the image is built
from ceph_namespace, ceph_tag, ceph_image defined in
container_image_prepare_defaults.yaml. If --image is
not passed then the default container defined in the
cephadm command is used instead. This patch adds the
--cephadm-default-container option to the 'openstack
overcloud ceph deploy' command so that --image is not
passed and whatever container is inside of cephadm is
used instead.

Depends-On: Ic4f626ebbe1a5332f9f285e5ea6aaa9f24a400b8
Change-Id: I3a1fe80042eed45e99a967531a60d523d4e260b7
"}]
commit_message:
Add option to bootstrap cephadm without --image

By default 'openstack overcloud ceph deploy' calls
'cephadm bootstrap --image' where the image is built
from ceph_namespace, ceph_tag, ceph_image defined in
container_image_prepare_defaults.yaml. If --image is
not passed then the default container defined in the
cephadm command is used instead. This patch adds the
--cephadm-default-container option to the 'openstack
overcloud ceph deploy' command so that --image is not
passed and whatever container is inside of cephadm is
used instead.

Depends-On: Ic4f626ebbe1a5332f9f285e5ea6aaa9f24a400b8
Change-Id: I3a1fe80042eed45e99a967531a60d523d4e260b7

commit_message:
[haproxy] optionally set socket to allow admin commands

Allow operators to set haproxy socket to admin level.
This is done via the flag haproxy_socket_level_admin which
is set to "no" by default.

Closes-Bug: 1960215

Signed-off-by: Imran Hussain <ih@imranh.co.uk>
Change-Id: Ia0da89288d68f5803ace1934c013053f12343195

commit_message:
Fix Redis config generation when fd limit changes

puppet-redis supports [1,2] changing PAM limits for the
file descriptors consumed by Redis. However puppet fails
to run systemd reload inside container-puppet-redis.

We have to keep Exec resources (for old pcs setup and for
manipulating the Redis config file), so silent the Exec
resource in that call systemd reload.

Closes-Bug: #1960134

[1] https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-redis/issues/130
[2] https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-redis/pull/192

Change-Id: If3569c08edb4e820a4db11ac755f23de71059a10

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-02 19:42:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how tripleo_multipathd updates multipath.conf

This patch fixes a problem that causes a stack update to fail as a
result of changing the multipathd configuration. The original code
modifies /etc/multipath.conf on the host, and uses "podman cp" to
refresh the contents of the containers that require a copy.

The original intent was to avoid restarting containers that
asynchronously read from /etc/multipath.conf, but that approach no
longer works. Instead, the new code restarts each container that
needs its multipath.conf file refreshed.

At some point, podman (or something related) started using locks on
files used in a container volume mount. Now, attempts to update the
contents of /etc/multipath.conf inside a container will fail. Here's
an example when running the same command that tripleo_multipathd
executes:

[root@standalone ~]# podman cp /etc/multipath.conf multipathd:/etc/
Error: 2 errors occurred:
        * error copying to container: copier: put: error creating "/etc/multipath.conf": copier: put: error removing item to be overwritten "/etc/multipath.conf": unlinkat /etc/multipath.conf: device or resource busy
        * error copying from host: copier: get: "/etc/multipath.conf": error copying /etc/multipath.conf: io: read/write on closed pipe

Change-Id: I6bd5249e3cf930108f93aee1dbcad76dda94eaee
'}, {'created': '2022-02-09 16:39:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how tripleo_multipathd updates multipath.conf

This patch fixes a problem that causes a stack update to fail as a
result of changing the multipathd configuration. The original code
modifies /etc/multipath.conf on the host, and uses "podman cp" to
refresh the contents of the containers that require a copy.

The original intent was to avoid restarting containers that
asynchronously read from /etc/multipath.conf, but that approach no
longer works. Instead, the new code restarts each container that
needs its multipath.conf file refreshed.

At some point, podman (or something related) started using locks on
files used in a container volume mount. Now, attempts to update the
contents of /etc/multipath.conf inside a container will fail. Here's
an example when running the same command that tripleo_multipathd
executes:

[root@standalone ~]# podman cp /etc/multipath.conf multipathd:/etc/
Error: 2 errors occurred:
        * error copying to container: copier: put: error creating "/etc/multipath.conf": copier: put: error removing item to be overwritten "/etc/multipath.conf": unlinkat /etc/multipath.conf: device or resource busy
        * error copying from host: copier: get: "/etc/multipath.conf": error copying /etc/multipath.conf: io: read/write on closed pipe

Depends-On: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
Change-Id: I6bd5249e3cf930108f93aee1dbcad76dda94eaee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix how tripleo_multipathd updates multipath.conf

This patch fixes a problem that causes a stack update to fail as a
result of changing the multipathd configuration. The original code
modifies /etc/multipath.conf on the host, and uses "podman cp" to
refresh the contents of the containers that require a copy.

The original intent was to avoid restarting containers that
asynchronously read from /etc/multipath.conf, but that approach no
longer works. Instead, the new code restarts each container that
needs its multipath.conf file refreshed.

At some point, podman (or something related) started using locks on
files used in a container volume mount. Now, attempts to update the
contents of /etc/multipath.conf inside a container will fail. Here's
an example when running the same command that tripleo_multipathd
executes:

[root@standalone ~]# podman cp /etc/multipath.conf multipathd:/etc/
Error: 2 errors occurred:
        * error copying to container: copier: put: error creating "/etc/multipath.conf": copier: put: error removing item to be overwritten "/etc/multipath.conf": unlinkat /etc/multipath.conf: device or resource busy
        * error copying from host: copier: get: "/etc/multipath.conf": error copying /etc/multipath.conf: io: read/write on closed pipe

Depends-On: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
Change-Id: I6bd5249e3cf930108f93aee1dbcad76dda94eaee

commit_message:
Display error details

The red error box will now show why a lease failed to be created or
updated, for example if not enough resources are available.

Also remove "Please try again" which is not a helpful message.

commit_message:
Revert "Retire neutron-fwaas-dashboard project"

This reverts commit 4a0f1a3ae54a69f37ab38a0209e3a9996f727693.

Reason for revert:
Neutron drivers team agreed to include neutron-fwaas again to Neutron
stadium[1], and goverance change is proposed at [2].

[1] https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/neutron_drivers/2022/neutron_drivers.2022-01-28-14.00.log.html#l-14
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/828078

Change-Id: I5018dfdf9ea866e113a17f9bd5a3b153e4f1c08f

commit_message:
Improve error messag if subnet is not found

If a subnet that does not exist the error returned is:
 "Error managing network ports 'intenal_api_leaf2'"

This patch improves this by raising a more informative
error message.

Change-Id: Ic52d8c630d809efdabd10ec921deff83bbcd86bf

commit_message:
tuned - check packages before install

When repository files are present, but the ctlplane is not on a
routed network. (I.e the node cannot connect to repositories.)
The ansible built in `package` will fail despite the fact that
the packages is already installed.

This change adds a task to check that the packages required are
installed using `rpm --query --whatprovides <PGK_LIST>`. Pacage
installation task is skipped if package already installed.

Related: RHBZ#2048134
Related-Bug: #1959731
Change-Id: Ifcbde65af99039a261bc34a813bddfb29f63c1e1
(cherry picked from commit 5c09c0ee0292be370455b79e4bd4991b513b8017)

commit_message:
Only execute task when tripleo_backup_and_restore_historical is true

There is one task that needs to be deactivated when the mentioned
variable is false. This fix introduces this switch so it does the
intended job as explained in the documentation.

Change-Id: If6e1ae6345d42d994a26c0ba7bc16d36db25ed0c

commit_message:
tripleo-bootstrap - check packeges fact befor install

When repository files are present, but the ctlplane is not on a
routed network. (I.e the node cannot connect to repositories.)
The ansible built in `package` will fail despite the fact that
the packages is already installed.

This change adds a task to check that the packages required are
isntalled using `rpm --query --whatprovides <PGK_LIST>`.
`--whatprovides` is used to find out if a wrapper rpm for OVS with
custom versioning scheme is installed. If a wrapper is installed
'openvswitch' is appended to the list of installed packages.

Related: RHBZ#2048134
Closes-Bug: #1959731
Change-Id: Ie448e8f795325cc3ae357fae32f3a47406101f25
(cherry picked from commit 37fac649388e0bf39326bdaaefa5a104b6ef264c)

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: I56e04707036b994c52cc9cfcb19e6c37cd41309e

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-11 09:19:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Apparmor libvirt profile removal

The apparmor_parser actually doesn't remove the file or doesn't create
the symlink in '/etc/apparmor.d/disable' itself so the next run of the
baremetal role will fail with the error "Unable to remove "libvirtd".
Even more after reboot, the profile is still active. We need to
disable the profile completly ourselves. This change fixes the
idempotents of the baremetal role.

Closes-Bug: #1960302
Change-Id: I162e417387393e806886b1c9ea8053b89778b4d1
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix Apparmor libvirt profile removal

The apparmor_parser actually doesn't remove the file or doesn't create
the symlink in '/etc/apparmor.d/disable' itself so the next run of the
baremetal role will fail with the error "Unable to remove "libvirtd".
Even more after reboot, the profile is still active. We need to
disable the profile completly ourselves. This change fixes the
idempotents of the baremetal role.

Closes-Bug: #1960302
Change-Id: I162e417387393e806886b1c9ea8053b89778b4d1
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 75f55d13ad9060b7821a6e7702a347debd785ee9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-14 14:21:24.000000000', 'message': 'swift-ring-builder: exit ERROR (2) on uncaught exceptions

swift-ring-builder has three exit statuses: 0 (OK), 1 (WARNING),
2 (ERROR). Uncaught exceptions in python result in an exit code of 1,
so for example problems writing a builder file to disk will result in
an exit of 1 (warning) rather than 2 (error).

This commit addresses that by wrapping as much as possible inside an
exception handler that will instead produce the usual backtrace and
exit 2 (error) if an exception is thrown and not caught.

Closes-Bug: 1960657
Change-Id: I7cfeff4f436ade319cf21d0d29853931aef6d20f
'}, {'created': '2022-02-14 16:05:06.000000000', 'message': 'swift-ring-builder: exit ERROR (2) on uncaught exceptions

swift-ring-builder has three exit statuses: 0 (OK), 1 (WARNING),
2 (ERROR). Uncaught exceptions in python result in an exit code of 1,
so for example problems writing a builder file to disk will result in
an exit of 1 (warning) rather than 2 (error).

This commit addresses that by wrapping as much as possible inside an
exception handler that will instead produce the usual backtrace and
exit 2 (error) if an exception is thrown and not caught.

Closes-Bug: 1960657
Change-Id: I7cfeff4f436ade319cf21d0d29853931aef6d20f
'}, {'created': '2022-02-15 11:24:08.000000000', 'message': 'swift-ring-builder: exit ERROR (2) on uncaught exceptions

swift-ring-builder has three exit statuses: 0 (OK), 1 (WARNING),
2 (ERROR). Uncaught exceptions in python result in an exit code of 1,
so for example problems writing a builder file to disk will result in
an exit of 1 (warning) rather than 2 (error).

This addresses that by overriding sys.excepthook to produce the usual
backtrace and then exit 2 (error); excepthook is called when an
exception is unhandled, unless that is SystemExit.

Closes-Bug: 1960657
Change-Id: I7cfeff4f436ade319cf21d0d29853931aef6d20f
'}, {'created': '2022-02-15 14:29:32.000000000', 'message': 'swift-ring-builder: exit ERROR (2) on uncaught exceptions

swift-ring-builder has three exit statuses: 0 (OK), 1 (WARNING),
2 (ERROR). Uncaught exceptions in python result in an exit code of 1,
so for example problems writing a builder file to disk will result in
an exit of 1 (warning) rather than 2 (error).

This addresses that by overriding sys.excepthook to produce the usual
backtrace and then exit 2 (error); excepthook is called when an
exception is unhandled, unless that is SystemExit.

Closes-Bug: 1960657
Change-Id: I7cfeff4f436ade319cf21d0d29853931aef6d20f
'}]
commit_message:
swift-ring-builder: exit ERROR (2) on uncaught exceptions

swift-ring-builder has three exit statuses: 0 (OK), 1 (WARNING),
2 (ERROR). Uncaught exceptions in python result in an exit code of 1,
so for example problems writing a builder file to disk will result in
an exit of 1 (warning) rather than 2 (error).

This addresses that by overriding sys.excepthook to produce the usual
backtrace and then exit 2 (error); excepthook is called when an
exception is unhandled, unless that is SystemExit.

Closes-Bug: 1960657
Change-Id: I7cfeff4f436ade319cf21d0d29853931aef6d20f

commit_message:
Move 'hw:pmu', 'hw_pmu' parsing to nova.virt.hardware

Virtually all of the code for parsing 'hw:'-prefixed extra specs and
'hw_'-prefix image metadata properties lives in the 'nova.virt.hardware'
module. It makes sense for these to be included there. Do that.

Change-Id: I1fabdf1827af597f9e5fdb40d5aef244024dd015
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-11 01:38:09.000000000', 'message': "memcache: Add an 80% item_size_max warning

This patch continues to improve the memcache item size montoring.
The memcache middleware now has an option to provide the item_size_max,
when provided the MemcacheRing client will log a warning if an item is
>= 80%.

If the value is set to 'auto', the default, then it'll probe memcache
for it's item_size_max value via a 'stats settings' call. If this fails
the value will be set to None which will turn off the warning.

The probe doesn't work for anyone using mcrouter, so the value will
need to be set if you want the warning.

NOTE: This is sitll a wip, just getting it off my computer before I run
out of batteries. It still needs testing and tests.

Change-Id: I1fb50844d6b9571efaab8ac67705b2fc1fe93e25

commit_message:
memcache: Add an item_size_warning_threshold option

Whenever an item is set which is larger than item_size_warning_threshold
then a warning is logged in the form:

  'Item size larger than warning threshold: 2048576 (2Mi) >= 1000000 (977Ki)'

Setting the value to -1 (default) will turn off the warning.

Change-Id: I1fb50844d6b9571efaab8ac67705b2fc1fe93e25

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: I816a3034b055433a7688ac1165017c25f7fcf873

commit_message:
Add --reproduce-command in UC install and upgrade.

Document the usage of the --reproduce-command option to obtain a
reproducer file with the Ansible command used to re-run the very
same deployment playbooks.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/827494

commit_message:
Add tripleo_cephadm_default_container boolean

If tripleo_cephadm_default_container is true, then do not
call 'cephadm bootstrap' with --image and use whatever
default Ceph container is defined in the cephadm command.

Change-Id: Ic4f626ebbe1a5332f9f285e5ea6aaa9f24a400b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-15 20:27:20.000000000', 'message': "Read tenant config with care in github_manager

The addition of ACLs to zuul/main.yaml broke the naive parsing done
by the maintain-github-mirror playbook, as it assumed all list items
were tenant definitions. Add a conditional check to allow it to skip
past any which aren't.

Change-Id: I31ab916a17fd116f00e94ea7bfa4d7243c0e1c2c
"}]
commit_message:
Read tenant config with care in github_manager

The addition of ACLs to zuul/main.yaml broke the naive parsing done
by the maintain-github-mirror playbook, as it assumed all list items
were tenant definitions. Add a conditional check to allow it to skip
past any which aren't.

Change-Id: I31ab916a17fd116f00e94ea7bfa4d7243c0e1c2c

(8 comments)

I don't see a tempest test for this or a job that enables caching. Does that exist somewhere?

Especially with the functional test not really doing any cache validation, I think we probably should prioritize seeing that actually work before we call this done."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-08-27 13:17:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(4 comments)

> Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1
> 
> (8 comments)
> 
> I don't see a tempest test for this or a job that enables caching. Does that exist somewhere?
> 
> Especially with the functional test not really doing any cache validation, I think we probably should prioritize seeing that actually work before we call this done.

I don't think the plugin has test case for caching so QA would be the right group to probe for the in-tree tests for the caching feature in general. As per https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/HACKING.html#api-stability this specific api should not be tested in tempest just yet."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-08-27 13:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-08-27 14:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-08-31 14:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Moving it to Yoga cycle;
1. Even though base work is completed we need some fine tuning and documentation work to complete.
2. Need more test coverage, specifically need to cover negative scenarios.
3. Tempest work is pending and less likely possible to complete it in remaining time of this cycle
4. As cache prefetching is not supported in uwsgi mode, it is not possible to test it with uwsgi deployment.
5. Client side test coverage is also pending and we need to release python-glanceclient for Xena before Thursday.

FFE was option but we don't have enough bandwidth at the moment to work on the pending items to complete this work in this cycle."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-09-09 11:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This change adds the new cache API endpoints and their related
new policies.

commit_message:
Fix quota-set no required parameters on update

Fixes an issue on manila api while trying to update a quota
without specifying a value.

Change-Id: I660a0f703edf8bfd91f78ed1b0c258828a1d12a2
Closes-Bug: #1778975

commit_message:
Manage rsyslog configurations

This will allow to get a new resource in t-h-t in order to get a common,
unified way for rsyslog config management on the baremetal node.

Change-Id: Ia94c6ca587f945cd12f3958c892c418aa8f55604

commit_message:
DNM os_net_config logging to a file

It's too complicated to track the os_net_config logs with the current
plugin. This will log and keep at least the last run and the one before
that.

Change-Id: I8c48f65d20baba73fc316154e92e19ed2dd1057c

commit_message:
add retry to rhos-bootstrap package install, network not ready

The network on the overcloud nodes does not seem to be
fully up at the time package installs begin on the
overcloud.  Add a retry to mitigate.

Related-Bug -
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954108

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-15 12:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Apparmor libvirt profile removal

The apparmor_parser actually doesn't remove the file or doesn't create
the symlink in '/etc/apparmor.d/disable' itself so the next run of the
baremetal role will fail with the error "Unable to remove "libvirtd".
Even more after reboot, the profile is still active. We need to
disable the profile completly ourselves. This change fixes the
idempotents of the baremetal role.

Closes-Bug: #1960302
Change-Id: I162e417387393e806886b1c9ea8053b89778b4d1
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 75f55d13ad9060b7821a6e7702a347debd785ee9)

baremetal role will fail with the error "Unable to remove "libvirtd".
Even more after reboot, the profile is still active. We need to

Closes-Bug: #1960302

commit_message:
Fix Apparmor libvirt profile removal

The apparmor_parser actually doesn't remove the file or doesn't create
the symlink in '/etc/apparmor.d/disable' itself so the next run of the
baremetal role will fail with the error "Unable to remove "libvirtd".
Even more after reboot, the profile is still active. We need to
disable the profile completly ourselves. This change fixes the
idempotents of the baremetal role.

Closes-Bug: #1960302
Change-Id: I162e417387393e806886b1c9ea8053b89778b4d1
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 75f55d13ad9060b7821a6e7702a347debd785ee9)

commit_message:
Deprecate tenant_* properties

Tenant is a terminology used in old Keystone v2 API. This change
replaces it by "project" which is used in current Keystone v3 API.

Change-Id: I76799652ffa32dbe0447312fea72b0db0fab9743

commit_message:
Remove deprecated neutron_api_config

The neutron_api_config type was deprecated during Victoria cycle in
favor of the neutron_api_ini type which provides the same feature[1].

Because some cycles have passed since that deprecation, we are now
ready to remove it.

[1] 2daa0b16444f2a2a865b618cbca76fd18c6cd7c6

Change-Id: I8bdc79a599b740a12dc40f8733d210c2929f550c

commit_message:
Deploy Zun with Cinder Ceph support

Enables zun to access cinder volumes when cinder is configured to use
external ceph.
Copies ceph config file and ceph cinder keyring to /etc/ceph in
zun_compute container.

Closes-Bug: 1848934
Change-Id: Ie56868d5e9ed37a9274b8cbe65895f3634b895c8
(cherry picked from commit eb7e0f6fdac86ea9501b98e6e71554b024bffe96)

commit_message:
Use unix socket while granting access for the backup service

/root/.my.cnf is not stored on galera container anymore, so it's not
possible to run mysql_user via TCP connection.
Unix socket should be used instead.

Change-Id: I71bc866aedaa6fba3cc86d2a2a99ed32f0727c54

Drop nova_glance_api_servers variable

I don't think we will get to this for Victoria."}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-11-03 19:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-11-03 19:55:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-11-08 19:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Do we really require nginx here?'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-11-09 01:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

We likely need something more than certbot since the ACME response web server needs to bind to non standard (not 80 or 443) port and the local ip address (not that domain ip address). Certbot standalone does not seem to be very configurable.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-11-09 09:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hmm... but then why not the already installed apache?'}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:45:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Hmm... but then why not the already installed apache?

There is no technical reason why nginx must be used. I wasn't aware that Apache is installed by default everywhere, and noticed bifrost was using nginx. I know that all the wsgi processes use apache but wasn't aware it was used for anything else. I'm not tied to nginx; it's the first tool I reached for. Probably rewriting the acme server config wouldn't be too hard.

As James says, the reason for the server at all is that certbot is not enough. In fact, when you run certbot in standalone mode, it will temporarily bind a HTTP server on to 80 to do the ACME HTTP challenge. The spec does not allow binding on to higher ports, as this opens it up to spurious authenticity claims. Because HAProxy is already going to be listening on that port, there is additional work in Kolla-Ansible to send requests on to the ACME server instead of Horizon if the request is for the well-known ACME challenge path."}, {'account_id': 29100, 'date': '2020-11-09 16:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-11-10 00:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-11-10 21:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2020-11-10 23:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

[{'created': '2021-12-02 18:57:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix set_property_atomic() boolean type casting

In set_property_atomic() we pass an integer query filter for the
deleted field, since most projects use an integer for this column.
However, in glance the column is a boolean, which trips up postgres
since the types are different (mysql and sqlite work fine). This

commit_message:
Fix set_property_atomic() boolean type casting

In set_property_atomic() we pass an integer query filter for the
deleted field, since most projects use an integer for this column.
However, in glance the column is a boolean, which trips up postgres
since the types are different (mysql and sqlite work fine). This
minor change to use False instead of 0 should fix that for postgres
users.

Change-Id: I5149df76943c1c19f3204b904c0e2d3ef846bdf7
Closes-Bug: #1953063

commit_message:
Disable barbican-ui dashboard

barbican-ui has not yet reached a 1.0.0 release and does not provide
a functioning UI for the key manager service at this time.

Once barbican-ui has basic functionality we can consider enabling this again.

Change-Id: I9fc9147263881cc96f8e51b739d2ccf6f1f9fbf9
(cherry picked from commit 51bea1095110777e30a357616e16d0f7c60b25a3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-15 13:36:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix race-condition when libvirt starts unwillingly

libvirtd.socket does monitor libvirtd.service and trigger service restart
when it spot that service is down.

However in order to enable tcp and tls sockets, we need libvirt
to be stopped.

Currently race condition can happen, when we stop libvirt, but it's
started by socket before we enable tls one.

To overcome this we stop socket along with service.

Change-Id: Iacc093311036fb8d6559a0e32252579303a639ba
(cherry picked from commit a3c0edba564beff374e5074ed6a00170b350bf2b)
"}, {'created': '2022-02-15 13:36:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix race-condition when libvirt starts unwillingly

libvirtd.socket does monitor libvirtd.service and trigger service restart
when it spot that service is down.

However in order to enable tcp and tls sockets, we need libvirt
to be stopped.

Currently race condition can happen, when we stop libvirt, but it's
started by socket before we enable tls one.

To overcome this we stop socket along with service.

Change-Id: Iacc093311036fb8d6559a0e32252579303a639ba
(cherry picked from commit a3c0edba564beff374e5074ed6a00170b350bf2b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race-condition when libvirt starts unwillingly

libvirtd.socket does monitor libvirtd.service and trigger service restart
when it spot that service is down.

However in order to enable tcp and tls sockets, we need libvirt
to be stopped.

Currently race condition can happen, when we stop libvirt, but it's
started by socket before we enable tls one.

To overcome this we stop socket along with service.

Change-Id: Iacc093311036fb8d6559a0e32252579303a639ba
(cherry picked from commit a3c0edba564beff374e5074ed6a00170b350bf2b)

commit_message:
Allow resizing to the same host

By default resizing an instance to the same host as the source is
not enabled. This change adds new charm config option that maps
directly to the nova.conf setting which effectively gives a user
possibility to enable/disable this functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1946620
Change-Id: I13d0c332cd0b110344b7a1645e3e4fd250fce33a
